Detailed Description

Representation of a generic chemical element.

It consists of:

  • A symbol which identifies the chemical element it represents.
    See also:
    setSymbol, symbol
  • A nucleon number (also called atomic mass number) which identifies this element as a specific isotope. The default nucleon number is the same (invalid) number for all elements ( naturalNucleonNr() ).
    See also:
    setNucleon, nucleon, isIsotope

bool ChemicalElementInterface::isIsotope ( void   )  const

Identifies an CompoundElement as isotope or natural element.

Returns:
True, if this element is an isotope. False, if it is a regular element.
See also:
setNucleon, nucleon, naturalNucleonNr

const int ChemicalElementInterface::naturalNucleonNr (  )  [static]

Returns the default nucleon number.

It is assigned to all elements which are considered to be not an isotope but a natural element which consists of a mixture of stable isotopes. It is an invalid number (negative).

See also:
setNucleon, nucleon, isIsotope

bool ChemicalElementInterface::operator< ( const ChemicalElementInterface &  e  )  const

Compares two elements lexically.

First, it compares the names of both elements. If the names are identical, the element with a lower nucleon number is less than the other element.

Parameters:
[in] e The element to compare this element with.
Returns:
True, if this element is less than the other provided element. False, otherwise.

std::string ChemicalElementInterface::toMarkup ( void   )  const

String representation with markup text formatting.

This includes <sup> for the nucleon number and <sub> for the coefficient value.

Returns:
The formatted string.

std::string ChemicalElementInterface::toString ( void   )  const

String representation of this element.

Builds a string with the symbol preceded by the nucleon number (if it is an isotope).

std::string ChemicalElementInterface::uniqueName ( void   )  const

Unique string representation of this element.

Same as toString() but will not be overridden by subclasses by default.
